title: Happy Hour
description: Oscar gets everybody in the office to go to Happy Hour so that he can hit on a coworker in shipping. Pam tries to set up Michael with a friend at the bar, but Michael's alter ego, "Date Mike," threatens to spoil the entire evening.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [Michael grunts and strains while doing push-ups] Breathe. Work your core. Come on.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, what did you do today?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, yeah, sitting on your big fat butt. Alright, that is the number to beat.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: What do we get if we do 'em?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: My respect. [everyone returns to work] Okay, I'll make it a little more interesting. Anyone who does more than 25 push-ups -

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Gets to go home. [everyone starts to do push-ups] Ooh! I say 'dance,' they say 'how high?' Here we go. Oh, no. No, no, no. Butt to high. [steps on Angela] Disqualified!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What do we got? Creed, disqualified.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: 19. [grunts] I had a really hard work out this morning.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [Stanley straining and breathing heavily] Oh, wow, that is adorable!

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Essentially, what we have here is one of those stories where a mother lifts a car to save her baby.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, it's not exactly fair. He's got all of his weight that's helping him go down.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: 25. Yeah! Come on, you can do it!

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: One more, one more! [cheers and applause]

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Well... Hey, uh, are you doing anything later tonight?

quotes.speaker: Matt
quotes.text: I don't know. I'm free. If you hear of anything going on, let me know.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Yeah, we talked this morning and we talked at Christmas. So, a little momentum there. [tries to open door, locked] Just a couple of hours to kill before work.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: You know what we haven't done in a while? Happy hour. Upstairs, the warehouse, everybody just going out for a drink.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Didn't we? I think we did.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: You want me to invite Matt?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Yeah, the whole gang, Matt included.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Look, just be straight with me, man. You can be gay with Matt, just be straight with me.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Hmmm, I saw a new drink on TV I'd like to try. I'll ask Bob.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Yeah, I love going to bars with Bob. I tend to wear something low-cut, get men to flirt with me, and Bob beats 'em up. What?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: A bunch of us are talking about happy hour.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I would love, love, love to go. Only problem is, Pam's at home with the baby and I think she wants a night in.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Absolutely, I will do that right now.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I gotta tell you, this baby is amazing. She gets me out of everything. And I - and I love her. I also love her, very much.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: So some of the co-workers were thinking of going out tonight, but I told them-

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [on phone] Yes! Yes! I would love to!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [through phone] It's been so long since I've been with adults. I am so excited to see everybody. Creed, Ryan. Oh my God, Stanley! Stanley's going to be there. Yes, oh my God!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I did not see this coming.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Erin, I need you to fax this and get me a confirmation, pronto. [whispering] Are you going later?

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Talk to me that way again, and I'll cut your face off.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: We recently struck up a romantic relationship. And, um...  but we're kinda keeping it quiet for now 'cause it's still kind of a new thing. It's a little delicate, and we just don't want all the drama.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Yeah, cause when everyone knows- [knock on window, open blinds to Kevin giggling and making sexual gestures] That's actually pretty funny, but in general, you know.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: A bunch of us are going to get some drinks, you in?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ladies and gentleman, it is quitting time.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Trying to get a head count.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: All right, yes! It's a deal.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh, hey, I invited my friend Julie.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I want her to meet Michael.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: They're both single, I have a sense they might-

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: You've been gone for a long time.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: It is not that. Kevin! Oh!

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Oh, I missed you so much.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Waaah! [starts to make crying baby noises]

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: When a new mom hears a baby cry, her you-know-what's fill up with you-know-what, and then her shirt gets, you know... that would be funny.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, wow, I cannot believe this is happening. This is everything I dreamed. Oh, my God! [laughs]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: It's not a birthday, it's not a good-bye party...

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh, hey, Pam and I are gonna go play pool with one of her friends, and we need a fourth.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Would you like to be our fourth?

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: So, the guy shows me the deck he's built. And I'm like, 'I'll call this a deck if it'll make you happy, but this is just a porch without a roof.' [laughter, Oscar looks toward door] It was ridiculous man, it was like-you could maybe get two chairs on the thing. Two lawn chairs.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What is a nice girl like you hanging out with these bums for? [Julie laughs]

quotes.speaker: Julie
quotes.text: So you work with Pam and Jim?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, no, no. Pam and Jim work for me. And if they win, they are fired.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No. No, not really. Not really, but they better not win.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Hey, Isabel, you made it. Oh, my goodness.

quotes.speaker: Isabel
quotes.text: Um, I'm gonna do a lap. See if I know anyone.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: And then they said the most ridiculous thing about Anderson Cooper, which I do not have the decency to repeat, but trust me when I tell you that-

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Hold that thought. Well, well, well. If it isn't Isabel.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: What's a girl like you doing in a place like this?

quotes.speaker: Isabel
quotes.text: A girl like me is why a guy like you comes to a place like this.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Usually means there's a battle scene coming.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: See, I didn't think you could teach that. I thought that was something you were born with. What am I thinking right now?

quotes.speaker: Julie
quotes.text: Are you thinking that I said 'ESP?'

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes. I feel like an idiot. Awesome.

quotes.speaker: Julie
quotes.text: I was a little nervous when Pam told me he was her boss, but he doesn't act like a boss at all. If I had a boss like that, we'd never get anything done.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: About you two hitting it off.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [removing tie] Well, apparently, Michael Scott is on a date. And that, that my friend, changes everything. [puts on backwards golf cap]

quotes.speaker: Hide
quotes.text: My brother, good head, bad heart. Good head, bad heart.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Hey, Michael, where have you been? [Michael shoots pool ball up into their faces]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Hey, you're supposed to hit the white ball first, buddy. Nice one. Can I talk to you for a sec? All right. Everything ok?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Why are you wearing a hat now?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Guys, come on, I'm on a date. Let me do my thang.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hi, I'm date Mike. Nice to meet me. How do you like your eggs in the morning? [tries to wink]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: You want to just make a run for it?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Waaaah! [Kevin fake-cries into Pam's chest] Waaaaah! Mommy!

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: We're focusing, we're focusing, we can't talk.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Guys, guys, guys, please. [game ends] Ok, all right, it's all yours now.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: If we save 'em up, we can get more than a sticker this time.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Stop telling me how to spend my tickets.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: I know, but you wanted the big thing.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Wow, can you imagine what people would say if they saw us dancing together?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: They'd be like, 'what's up with those two?'

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: 'Did we miss the wedding?' Um, I got it-I'll do this, and you play the racing game, and then we'll switch.

quotes.speaker: Isabel
quotes.text: Oh, air hockey, basketball, we could play that. Oh, whack-a-mole.

quotes.speaker: Isabel
quotes.text: Two are in the Marines, one's a cop.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Angela versus Isabel. Height, advantage Isabel. Birthing hips, advantage Isabel. Remaining child-bearing years, advantage Isabel. Legal obligation, advantage Angela.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hey, guys, guys, guys. [steals a cherry from waitress passing buy] Watch this. Ready?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I'm tying a knot in the stem with my tongue.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Michael, you don't have to do this.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [choking] Wow. Oh, wow, that was close.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I would say I kind of have an unfair advantage because I watch reality dating shows like a hawk, and I learn. I absorb information from the strategies of the winners and the losers. Actually, I probably learn more from the losers.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: This is exactly what I don't want, the drama. I don't want the drama!

quotes.speaker: Isabel
quotes.text: [Isabel and Dwight playing whack-a-mole] You are amazing at this. How did you get so good?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Whacking moles. Hit 'em on the head. Whack. Say it with me.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Listen, can I talk to you for a second?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Look, I've been thinking. We had a good run. We really did. But you don't need to worry about this whole contract thing anymore.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: It's just that we both-we want different things. You know, I want a big family.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: No, no, no, no. I want a big family. Tall. Thick. A big, physically big family. Listen, you go have fun. You're off the hook.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Dissolved. Don't worry, you're free. Okay? Okay. See you later.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [Michael playing air guitar on pool table] Wow. Maybe we should tell her that he's not normally like this.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Maybe it should come from a man.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Maybe it should come from a note... with flowers...tomorrow.

quotes.speaker: Bar Manager
quotes.text: You wanna pay 400 bucks to re-felt this table?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah, why don't you send the bill to 23 I Don't Care Lane, Scranton, Pennsylvania?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Hey, Michael, why don't you just get down.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hey, she can tell I'm on a date, right? Right? I'm just having fun.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Really? You told on me. That's lame.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay, all right. Okay, whoa. I'm just kidding around. I'm sorry.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Ok, um, why don't we just finish the game? Michael, it's your shot.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: She can't talk to us that way.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: You guys are stripes, I think...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You let somebody talk to you like that, where does it stop?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, I am starting it again!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Do you guys want some food? The wings are really good here.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hey, you embarrassed my friends in front of me and I'm gonna need you to go back over to the table and apologize.

quotes.speaker: Bar Manager
quotes.text: Then I am sorry that I didn't kick you out.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I am here with my employees. I am here on a date. Hello.

quotes.speaker: Bar Manager
quotes.text: Well, uh, I'm the manager here, sir.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, it just so happens that I am a manager too. And the way I manage people is that I touch their hearts and souls with humor, with love and maybe a dash of razzle-dazzle. And I don't see that from you.

quotes.speaker: Bar Manager
quotes.text: Is that how you do it?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes it is. I am writing a book about it.

quotes.speaker: Bar Manager
quotes.text: Really? How much have you written?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I've written all of it... in my head.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: If you're really interested, it's called 'Somehow I Manage' and there's going to be a picture of me on the cover, shrugging, with my sleeves rolled up.

quotes.speaker: Bar Manager
quotes.text: Huh. Have you read Lee Iacocca's? It's a classic.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Read it? I own it. But no, I have not read it.

quotes.speaker: Bar Manager
quotes.text: Dude, tonight! You're not going to want to put it down. It's gonna make you want to go out and buy a Chrysler tomorrow.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: We just have to throw everyone off the scent a little, so follow my lead.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: [Andy sits at table with another woman] Hi.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I don't normally do this, but...

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Just sit down next to a beautiful woman and start talking to myself to confuse other people.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: [Erin sits with man, rubs her hand on his thigh] Hey, big boy. Do you like it when I do that?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: [Andy spits out his drink] What are you doing?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: We didn't say we were gonna, like, start groping strangers!

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: I was flirting with a man.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Get in here. [Andy and Erin go into photo booth] Where did you learn to talk like that?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Well, what movie? Black Snake Moan?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I manage a paper company-Dunder Mifflin/Sabre.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I did. I actually put it in your bowl.

quotes.speaker: Bar Manager
quotes.text: Whoa, a lot of Stanley Hudson's in here.

quotes.speaker: Bar Manager
quotes.text: You just won yourself a lunch.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I'm sorry, he's not usually like that.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: He's more, just... like... you can go.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hey, Julie! You having fun? [Julie leaves]

quotes.speaker: Bar Manager
quotes.text: So... when are you coming in for that free lunch? You're gonna want to come in on a day that I'm working. Uh, maybe I can hear more about that book, too.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Hey, man, you put together a pretty fun night for everybody. I saw you talking to Hide. Did you hear that dude's life story? It's amazing, right?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: I couldn't understand a word he said.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Let me tell you something, Oscar. All right, Matt's an okay dude, but he's a dummy. You guys got nothing in common.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Maybe you're right. I should count myself lucky.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: There he is! Hey, hey, hey.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: This is not what I want my relationship to look like. [holding photo strip of he and Erin fighting]

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: [over PA] Hi, ladies and gentlemen. My name is Andrew Bernard, and I've been on two dates with Erin Hannon and they went well, and there will probably be more. Thank you.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: You know, it got to the point where keeping it a secret was just too much drama. And I hate drama, so there you go.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I know, I do, right? I'm a total drama queen.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: With this move, he can't get you.

quotes.speaker: Isabel
quotes.text: Well, I think that he could counter that move. The Scranton strangler is a professional strangler.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Oh, please. I wish he'd come after me.  I would be like-aaah!

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: You are hereby served with a summons to appear in Lackawanna county court.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: No, no, no. [trying to talk over her] Blah blah blah blah!

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: For breach of contract with Angela Noelle Martin.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Dwight recently entered into a contract with me, establishing intent to conceive and raise a child with me.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Did he not tell you that?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: You're really putting me in an awkward position here.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Do you plan on raising a child with me? Or do you plan on breaking this contract?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: You'll see me in small claims court!

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: [crying] Then, I spilled my drink, and they wouldn't give me a refill.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Okay, we have to get home.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Halperts, wait up. Oh, what a great night. Got to hang out with my peeps. Sort of did okay with a new young lady.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I think I did. But I can't take all of the credit. Some of the credit is due, in fact, to my good friend, Date Mike. Nice to meet me.

quotes.speaker: Hide
quotes.text: In Japan, heart surgeon. Number one. Steady hand. One day, yakuza boss need new heart. I do operation. But, mistake! Yakuza boss die. Yakuza very mad. I hide in fishing boat, come to America. No English,  no food, no money. Darryl give me job. Now I have house, American car, and new woman. Darryl save life. My big secret: I kill yakuza boss on purpose. I good surgeon. The best!
